   20: -module(slave_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   25: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, t_start/1, t_start_link/1,
   26: 	 start_link_nodedown/1, errors/1]).
   27: 
   28: %% Internal exports.
   29: -export([fun_init/1, test_errors/1]).
   30: -export([timeout_test/1, auth_test/1, rsh_test/1, start_a_slave/3]).
   31: 
   32: suite() ->
   33:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   34:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   35: 
   36: all() -> 
   37:     [t_start_link, start_link_nodedown, t_start, errors].
   38: 
   39: groups() -> 
   40:     [].
   41: 
   42: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   43:     Config.
   44: 
   45: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   46:     ok.
   47: 
   48: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   49:     Config.
   50: 
   51: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   52:     Config.
   53: 
   54: 
   55: t_start_link(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   56:     %% Define useful variables.
   57: 
   58:     Host = host(),
   59:     Slave1 = node_name(Host, slave1),
   60:     Slave2 = node_name(Host, slave2),
   61: 
   62:     %% Test slave:start_link() with one, two, and three arguments.
   63: 
   64:     ThisNode = node(),
   65:     {error, {already_running, ThisNode}} = slave:start_link(Host),
   66:     {ok, Slave1} = slave:start_link(Host, slave1),
   67:     {ok, Slave2} = slave:start_link(Host, slave2, "-my_option 42"),
   68:     {ok, [["42"]]} = rpc:call(Slave2, init, get_argument, [my_option]),
   69: 
   70:     %% Kill the two slave nodes and verify that they are dead.
   71: 
   72:     rpc:cast(Slave1, erlang, halt, []),
   73:     rpc:cast(Slave2, erlang, halt, []),
   74:     ct:sleep(250),
   75:     is_dead(Slave1),
   76:     is_dead(Slave2),
   77: 
   78:     %% Start two slave nodes from another process and verify that
   79:     %% the slaves die when that process terminates.
   80: 
   81:     Parent = self(),
   82:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun () ->
   83: 			    {ok, Slave1} = slave:start_link(Host, slave1),
   84: 			    {ok, Slave2} = slave:start_link(Host, slave2),
   85: 			    Parent ! slaves_started,
   86: 			    receive never -> ok end
   87: 		    end),
   88:     receive slaves_started -> ok end,
   89:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
   90:     wait_alive(Slave1),
   91:     wait_alive(Slave2),
   92:     exit(Pid, kill),
   93:     receive {'EXIT', Pid, killed} -> ok end,
   94:     ct:sleep(250),
   95:     is_dead(Slave1),
   96:     is_dead(Slave2),
   97: 
   98:     ok.
   99: 
  100: %% Test that slave:start_link() works when the master exits.
  101: 
  102: start_link_nodedown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  103:     %% Define useful variables.
  104: 
  105:     Host = host(),
  106:     Master = node_name(Host, my_master),
  107:     Slave = node_name(Host, my_slave),
  108: 
  109:     Pa = "-pa " ++ filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  110:     {ok, Master} = slave:start_link(Host, my_master, Pa),
  111:     spawn(Master, ?MODULE, start_a_slave, [self(), Host, my_slave]),
  112:     {reply, {ok, _Node}} = receive Any -> Any end,
  113: 
  114:     rpc:call(Master, erlang, halt, []),
  115:     receive after 200 -> ok end,
  116:     pang = net_adm:ping(Slave),
  117: 
  118:     ok.
  119: 
  120: start_a_slave(ReplyTo, Host, Name) ->
  121:     ReplyTo ! {reply, slave:start_link(Host, Name)},
  122:     receive never -> ok end.
  123: 
  124: %% Test slave:start().
  125: 
  126: t_start(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  127:     %% Define useful variables.
  128: 
  129:     Host = host(),
  130:     Slave1 = node_name(Host, slave1),
  131:     Slave2 = node_name(Host, slave2),
  132: 
  133:     %% By running all tests from this master node which is linked
  134:     %% to this test case, we ensure that all slaves are killed
  135:     %% if this test case fails.  (If they are not, and therefore further
  136:     %% test cases fail, there is a bug in slave.)
  137: 
  138:     {ok, Master} = slave:start_link(Host, master),
  139: 
  140:     %% Test slave:start() with one, two, and three arguments.
  141: 
  142:     ThisNode = node(),
  143:     {error, {already_running, ThisNode}} = slave:start(Host),
  144:     {ok, Slave1} = rpc:call(Master, slave, start, [Host, slave1]),
  145:     {ok, Slave2} = rpc:call(Master, slave, start,
  146: 			    [Host, slave2, "-my_option 42"]),
  147:     {ok, [["42"]]} = rpc:call(Slave2, init, get_argument, [my_option]),
  148: 
  149:     %% Test that a slave terminates when its master node terminates.
  150: 
  151:     ok = slave:stop(Slave2),
  152:     is_dead(Slave2),
  153:     {ok, Slave2} = rpc:call(Slave1, slave, start, [Host, slave2]),
  154:     is_alive(Slave2),
  155:     rpc:call(Slave1, erlang, halt, []),	% Kill master.
  156:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,		% Make sure slaves have noticed
  157: 						% their dead master.
  158:     is_dead(Slave1),
  159:     is_dead(Slave2),			% Slave should be dead, too.
  160: 
  161:     %% Kill all slaves and verify that they are dead.
  162: 
  163:     ok = slave:stop(Slave1),
  164:     ok = slave:stop(Slave2),
  165:     is_dead(Slave1),
  166:     is_dead(Slave2),
  167: 
  168:     ok.
  169: 
  170: %% Test the various error conditions in parallell (since the timeout
  171: %% in slave is 32 seconds).
  172: 
  173: errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  174:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  175:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  176:     {ok, Master} = slave_start_link(host(), master,
  177: 				    "-rsh no_rsh_program -pa "++Pa++
  178: 					" -env ERL_CRASH_DUMP erl_crash_dump.master"),
  179:     Pids = rpc:call(Master, ?MODULE, test_errors, [self()]),
  180:     wait_for_result(Pids),
  181: 
  182:     ok.
  183: 
  184: wait_for_result([]) ->
  185:     ok;
  186: wait_for_result(Pids) ->
  187:     receive
  188: 	{'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
  189: 	    io:format("Process ~p terminated", [Pid]),
  190: 	    wait_for_result(lists:delete(Pid, Pids));
  191: 	{'EXIT', _, Reason} ->
  192: 	    exit(Reason)
  193:     end.
  194: 
  195: show_process_info(Pid) ->
  196:     io:format("~p: ~p", [Pid, catch process_info(Pid, initial_call)]).
  197: 
  198: test_errors(ResultTo) ->
  199:     %% Sigh!  We use ordinary spawn instead of fun_spawn/1 to be able
  200:     %% identify the processes by their initial call.
  201:     P1 = spawn(?MODULE, timeout_test, [ResultTo]),
  202:     P2 = spawn(?MODULE, auth_test, [ResultTo]),
  203:     P3 = spawn(?MODULE, rsh_test, [ResultTo]),
  204:     Pids =[P1, P2, P3],
  205:     lists:foreach(fun show_process_info/1, Pids),
  206:     Pids.
  207: 
  208: timeout_test(ResultTo) ->
  209:     link(ResultTo),
  210:     {error, timeout} = slave:start(host(), slave1, "-boot no_boot_script").
  211: 
  212: auth_test(ResultTo) ->
  213:     link(ResultTo),
  214:     {error, timeout} = slave:start(host(), slave2,
  215: 				   "-setcookie definitely_not_a_cookie").
  216: 
  217: rsh_test(ResultTo) ->
  218:     link(ResultTo),
  219:     {error, no_rsh} = slave:start(super, slave3).
  220: 
  221: 
  222: %%% Utilities.    
  223: 
  224: 
  225: wait_alive(Node) ->
  226:     wait_alive_1(10, Node).
  227: 
  228: wait_alive_1(0, Node) ->
  229:     ct:fail({still_not_alive,Node});
  230: wait_alive_1(N, Node) ->
  231:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_status, []) of
  232: 	{started,_} ->
  233: 	    ok;
  234: 	{starting,_} ->
  235: 	    receive after 1 -> ok end,
  236: 	    wait_alive_1(N-1, Node)
  237:     end.
  238: 
  239: is_alive(Node) ->
  240:     {started, _} = rpc:call(Node, init, get_status, []).
  241: 
  242: is_dead(Node) ->
  243:     {badrpc, nodedown} = rpc:call(Node, init, get_status, []).
  244: 
  245: node_name(Host, Name) ->
  246:     list_to_atom(lists:concat([Name, "@", Host])).
  247: 
  248: host() ->
  249:     from($@, atom_to_list(node())).
  250: 
  251: from(H, [H | T]) -> T;
  252: from(H, [_ | T]) -> from(H, T);
  253: from(_H, []) -> [].
  254: 
  255: slave_start_link(Host, Name, Args) ->
  256:     case slave:start_link(Host, Name, Args) of
  257: 	{ok, Node} ->
  258: 	    {ok, Node};
  259: 	Other ->
  260: 	    io:format("slave:start_link(~p, ~p, ~p) -> ~p",
  261: 		      [Host, Name, Args, Other])
  262:     end.
  263: 
  264: fun_spawn(Fun) ->
  265:     spawn_link(?MODULE, fun_init, [Fun]).
  266: 
  267: fun_init(Fun) ->
  268:     Fun().
